Description:
Manage team of engineers on the site 4-5 ( mechanical engineer , hull, and outfitting engineer , ETO , interior coordinator )
Provision of monthly build reports to summarize build progress.
Provision of technical comment on design issues with the site team
Oversight of the plan approval process with Class and Flag.
Liaise with the shipyard in regard to the delivery demarcation schedule.
Assist with owner supply budgets and the selection of suitable suppliers.
Assistance and logistics management of Owner supply items – tenders, toys, diving equipment, uniforms, crockery, cutlery, etc (note full Owner supply procurement services can be supplied subject to a separate contract).
Appraisal of engineering system drawings.
Liaise with Classification and Flag Authorities as necessary.
Supervise all aspects of construction.
Approve equipment purchases, within the context of the approved maker’s list in the technical specification.
Work closely with project designers in selection of the luxury interior outfitting companies.
Work closely with site team to manage all inspection and test during the building progress
Coordinate with hull Painting specialist will be appointed by owner for hull painting schedule , to achieve best results for hull and superstructure paintingSkills
Skills:
Master’s degree (Captain ) or Naval Architecture or 1st Class Chief Engineer
7-10 years’ ship building experience in (prefer with Yachts building experience ).
medical insurance, Leave 45 days paid leave and flight ticket to nearest home station of the candidate.
